Meta rolls out teen safeguards for Instagram, Facebook, Messenger
items.summary:
- Meta introduces new safety measures for teenagers on Instagram, Facebook, and Messenger to enhance protection for users under 18.
- Updates include restrictions on Instagram's Live feature and new parental controls for accounts under 16, requiring parental permission.
- Rollout of Facebook and Messenger's teen accounts will start in the US, UK, Australia, and Canada as part of compliance with the UK's Online Safety Act.

items.title: Accel Partner and Sports Club Owner Launch $1 Billion VC Fund
items.author: Ryan Smith, Ryan Sweeney
items.summary:
- Ryan Smith and Ryan Sweeney launched Halo Experience (HX One), a $1 billion venture capital fund focused on sports tech and experiential sectors.
- The fund aims to capitalize on the rapid growth of the global sports technology market projected to reach $55 billion by 2030.
- Industry experts prioritize fan engagement technologies as key investment areas in sports, highlighting shifts in audience interaction and content consumption.

items.title: Device-as-a-service better than BNPL?
items.author: Miguel
items.summary:
- Cinch, a Singapore-based startup, offers a device-as-a-service model allowing businesses to rent gadgets like laptops and smartphones.
- This service provides lower rates and faster access compared to traditional buy now, pay later (BNPL) options.
- Cinch aims to increase its device circulation to 1 million within the next five years.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Israel
items.summary:
- The article features startups in Israel that are on track to becoming significant players in the market.
- It is based on recently raised funding rounds and includes startups up to the series E stage.
- A subscription is required to access the full details of the funding rounds and other information.

items.title: Apple exported $17.4b in iPhones from India: minister
items.author: Ashwini Vaishnaw
items.summary:
- Apple Inc. exported iPhones worth over 1.5 trillion rupees (US$17.4 billion) from India in the last fiscal year.
- This marks a significant effort by Apple to diversify manufacturing away from China.
- India‚Äôs total smartphone exports exceeded 2 trillion rupees (US$23.1 billion) for the fiscal year ending March 2025, a 54% increase compared to the previous year.
- Apple‚Äôs production boost in India was supported by government subsidies and Prime Minister Modi‚Äôs initiatives.
- India, from a position of only 25% self-sufficiency in smartphone production in 2014-15, is now nearly self-sufficient.
- Despite significant gains, India‚Äôs total mobile phone exports for FY24 stand at $15.6 billion, below the ambitious target of $110 billion for 2025.

items.title: Enterprise HR firm Workday taps ex-Salesforce exec to lead ASEAN
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Workday appoints Jess O‚ÄôReilly as general manager for ASEAN, based in Singapore.
- O‚ÄôReilly to manage growth strategy and enhance client and partner relationships.
- She brings over 15 years of tech experience from Salesforce, UiPath, and Twilio.
- The ASEAN HR software market is expected to grow from $578.4 million in 2024 to $1,335.9 million by 2030.
- O‚ÄôReilly‚Äôs leadership will support Workday‚Äôs expansion and enhance customer engagement in a competitive market.
- Competitors include SAP SuccessFactors, Oracle Fusion Cloud HCM, and Ceridian Dayforce, focusing on AI integrations in HR processes.
- Effective leadership transitions are linked to improved organizational performance, emphasizing the need for growth-oriented tech executives.

items.title: Taiwanese exporters hit by US tech content tariff rule
items.summary:
- Taiwanese exporters are facing challenges due to new U.S. tech content tariffs.
- The tariffs impact the pricing and competitiveness of Taiwanese tech products in U.S. markets.
- Exporters are seeking strategies to comply with the new regulations while minimizing impact on sales.

items.title: Israeli compliance startup Anecdotes bags $30m series B
items.author: Yair Kuznitsov, Roi Amior
items.summary:
- Anecdotes has raised an additional US$30 million in funding, totaling US$55 million in its Series B round, led by DTCP.
- Founded in 2020, the company specializes in governance, risk management, and compliance (GRC) solutions with a focus on cybersecurity.
- To date, Anecdotes has raised US$85 million and employs around 100 people in Tel Aviv.
- The funding reflects rising regulatory demands due to AI and evolving cyber threats.
- Anecdotes‚Äô platform automates compliance processes by integrating with enterprise systems to collect data, improving efficiency over traditional methods.
- The GRC market is evolving to view compliance as a strategic business enabler rather than just a regulatory requirement.
- 92% of organizations are increasing budgets for regulatory compliance amid a complex regulatory landscape, notably with new frameworks like the EU‚Äôs DORA.
- Automation is crucial as manual compliance processes become unsustainable; the shift is necessary to meet growing regulatory burdens and complexities introduced by AI regulations.

items.title: SK Group to sell its semiconductor wafer subsidiary‚Äôs stake
items.summary:
- SK Group is considering selling a controlling stake (70.6%) in its semiconductor wafer subsidiary, SK Siltron Co.
- SK Siltron is South Korea‚Äôs only producer of semiconductor wafers, ranking third globally in the 12-inch wafer market with an estimated value of 5 trillion won ($3.38 billion).
- The group‚Äôs holding company, SK Inc., is reportedly in discussions with private equity firms regarding the sale, part of SK Group's restructuring efforts which began last year.

items.summary:
- The article explores recent trends in Southeast Asia's funding landscape, analyzing investor activity and notable funding rounds.
- It comprises two main sections: a weekly update showcasing recent investors and companies, and a macro trends section that illustrates funding distribution across regions and sectors.
- Notable contributors to the content include infographics by Yeo Cheng Yong and editing by Terence Lee.

Creative Gorilla Capital backs MY collectibles platform‚Äôs funding
items.summary:
- Hoopi Holdings Pte Ltd completes its first funding round led by Creative Gorilla Capital.
- The funding will facilitate Hoopi's expansion in Southeast Asia, particularly in Indonesia and Thailand.
- Launched in September 2024, Hoopi has achieved a GMV of nearly US$2.25 million with over 40,000 paid orders as of February 2025.
- Currently operates in Malaysia and Singapore with more than 20,000 active users and 3,000 registered sellers.
- Offers a marketplace, auction trading, local card grading, and gamified experiences for collectibles.

items.title: Musk‚Äôs DOGE uses AI to monitor US federal workers: sources
Who‚Äôs investing in India‚Äôs SaaS startups?
items.author: Terence Lee, Mina Deocareza
items.summary:
- Highlights active investors in India's SaaS sector over the past two years based on the number of deals.
- Aims to assist founders seeking funding in this area.
- Encourages feedback on inaccuracies at research@techinasia.com.
- Offers more investor funding data through a provided link.
